page.title: 08SCHOOLING
page.content: Schooling until the 1840's was restricted to several private schools for boys and girls and the Free Grammar School for Boys (1573) at St.Mary's until it moved as Queen Elizabeth Gram. School to its present site , later to become Atherstone Comprehensive School (1976). The working class childrens'ed. during Victorian times was started by religious bodies at the National School for infants and a British School.The first Board School was opened in North Sreet,followed a few years later by a Girl school in Owen Street.Today the town has three Middle Schools,together with their three supporting First Schools contributing to the future pop. of the Comprehensive School.Falling rolls in recent have meant that staff numbers have been reduced and the width in the curriculum subsequently affected
